greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: "Look to the left" sequence starting with (1, 2): when the sequence has n terms, extend it by appending a(n) copies of a(1..n-1).
comment: Stage 1: last term of 1,2 is 2 hence we add 2 copies of the block to the left of the last term (here 1) giving 1,2,1,1.
Stage 2: last term of 1,2,1,1 is 1 hence we add one copy of the block to the left of the last term (here 1,2,1) giving 1,2,1,1,1,2,1.
Stage 3: last term of 1,2,1,1,1,2,1 is 1 hence we add one copy of the block to the left of the last term (here 1,2,1,1,1,2) giving 1,2,1,1,1,2,1,1,2,1,1,1,2.
link: Iain Fox, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10369
Benoit Cloitre, Plot of Sum_{k=1..n} a(k)/n
formula: It seems that lim_{n->infinity} (a(1) + a(2) + ... + a(n))/n = 1.27526... (see link and A296564).
Because of the previous statement, it seems that the ratio of 2s to 1s in this sequence is 1:2.6329... (see A297927). - _Iain Fox_, Oct 15 2017
mathematica: f[s_List] := Block[{a = Flatten[s][[-1]], b = Most@ s}, s = Join[s, Flatten@ Table[b, {a}]]]; Nest[f, {1, 2}, 6] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 23 2017 *)
xref: "Look to the left" sequences: A322423 (seed 1,2,3), A322424 (seed 1,2,3,4), A322425 (seed 1,2,3,4,5).
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Oct 14 2017
ext: Self-contained name from _M. F. Hasler_, Dec 10 2018
